title: Teacher Program: Exhibition Snapshot—Gauguin: Artist as Alchemist
description:
Immerse yourself in Gauguin: Artist as Alchemist, an exhibition that examines the artist’s radical experiments in the applied arts, underscoring his practice not only as a painter but also as a sculptor, ceramist, printmaker, and decorator. This workshop, which will focus on the intersection of art and science, includes an overview of the exhibition, an interactive gallery experience and discussion of resources and ideas for incorporating this content into different areas of the curriculum.

Exhibition Snapshot is a program format that features guest artists, curators, and educators discussing special exhibitions. This workshop is open to teachers of all grades and disciplines.

Registration is required for this program.

For additional teacher workshops, please visit the Teacher Programs calendar.

If you have any questions or special needs, please call (312) 443-3719 or e-mail ERC@artic.edu.
